titlestmt.titleproper: Frédéric Louis Ritter Item Scans and PapersMS096

publicationstmt.publisher: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-10 19:01:53 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Frédéric Louis Ritter Item Scans and Papers
did.langmaterial: English German French Italian Spanish; Castilian Latin

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in three series: Scores; Texts; Ritter primary source and collection documents.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Material in series 3 was pulled from the DCA collection documentation file, originally MS014, in June 2011. Please refer to collection documentation file MS096 for material regarding missing Ritter items over the years, preservation concerns, NEH grant material (2003) among others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains papers of Frédéric Louis Ritter and select scanned images of the musical scores and texts from the Frédéric Louis Ritter collection, Special Collections, Tisch Library, which is not a DCA collection. Items listed in the finding aid reflect only the digitized portions of the collection and supporting papers and collection documentation.

Series 3 contains a few letters, historical catalogs of the Ritter collection circa 1940 (already intermixed with the overall Albert Metcalf collection), and a score fragment (unknown composer and language.)

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frederic Louis Ritter (1834-1891) was a German composer and author. After Ritter's death, Albert Metcalf bought Ritter's music collection, and donated it to Tufts University. Frederic Louis Ritter was born in Strasbourg, France, on June 22, 1834. Growing up, Ritter studied both French and Germanic styles of music. At the age of 18, he was appointed to be a professor of music at the Protestant Seminary of Fénéstrange. Ritter immigrated to the United States in 1856 at the age of 23, following his relatives; at the time, he was noted to possess an extraordinarily large music collection. Initially, Ritter moved to Cincinnati, where he founded the Cecilia and Philharmonic Societies. He moved to New York City in 1862, and had a large influence over the musical scene. There, he directed both the Sacred Harmonic and Arion Choral Societies, and organized "what is considered to be the city's first music festival" at Steinway Hall in 1867. He was made a Professor of Music at Vassar College in the same year, and rose to become Director of the department in 1878. He was awarded an honorary Doctor of Music in 1877 from New York University. Ritter died in Antwerp, Belgium, on July 6, 1891. Soon after Ritter's death, Albert Metcalf purchased Ritter's music collection, containing rare musical scores and texts. Metcalf continued to add to the collection after Ritter's death, and donated the entire collection to Tufts as the Albert Metcalf Musical Library, on November 27, 1901.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more information on the books of the Ritter collection, the Tisch Library online catalog should be consulted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains select scanned images of musical scores from the Frédéric Louis Ritter collection, Special Collections, Tisch Library, which is not a DCA collection. Most scores date from the 18th century and are by composers such as Franz Schubert, Carl Bach, Jean Phillippe Rameau, and Joseph Mehul.
Items listed in this series reflect only the digitized portions of the scores.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more information on the Ritter collection, the Tisch Library online catalog should be consulted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is an image book created from the score of Die Winterreise by Franz Schubert, with the lyrics in both German and French. Berger Family Technology Transfer Endowment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains select scanned pages of music theory books from the Frédéric Louis Ritter collection, Special Collections, Tisch Library, which is not a DCA collection. The music theory books date primarily from the 18th century.
Items listed in this series reflect only the digitized portions of the music theory books.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more information on the Ritter collection, the Tisch Library online catalog should be consulted.

did.unittitle: Ritter primary source and collection documents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains original letters, copies of biographical sketches, historical catalogs of the Ritter collection c.a. 1940 (as the collection was already intermixed with the overall Albert Metcalf collection by that time), and an unidentified score fragment (language, composer, date); all items were pulled from the DCA collection documentation file, originally MS014, in June 2011. The historical catalogs contain handwritten notes correcting the publication's errors.
